title: Wolf Tooth Bottom Brackets Are Made in the USA
content:
Announced today, Minnesota-based manufacturer Wolf Tooth just rolled out its long-awaited bottom brackets, which are available today from your local dealer…

Wolf Tooth Bottom Brackets are engineered to be durable, reliable, lightweight, and smooth. The weather sealing is best-in-class, with seals in the spindle, bearing gutters, bearing inner and outer races, shells, and end caps. To prevent creaking, spindle bushings separate the bearing inner race and crank spindle to eliminate metal-on-metal contact. Like most Wolf Tooth components, the new bottom brackets are rebuildable and have replacement parts and service guides via Wolf Tooth Right to Repair, and are machined in Minnesota, USA.

Multiple Standards

Wolf Tooth Bottom Brackets are available in multiple BSA and T47 internal sizes for maximum spindle compatibility: 24, 29 (DUB), and 30mm. Adjustable-width sleeves allow BSA models to fit 68 and 73mm shells, with additional options available for 83 and 100mm shells. T47 internal models will fit 85.5 to 92mm shells. Wolf Tooth Bottom Brackets are also lighter weight than almost all other similar bottom brackets based on size.

Seals

The sealing in Wolf Tooth Bottom Brackets is best-in-class. Five seals and o-rings are designed to balance low drag with superior performance in all conditions. The system of a spindle o-ring, seals on the bearing/bushing gutter, inner (low contact) and outer bearing races, shell o-rings, and a labyrinth-style end cap ensure smooth spinning in sunshine, rain, snow, and mud alike.

Creak Free

Wolf Tooth Bottom Brackets don’t creak. Custom bushings separate the bearing inner race and crank spindle to eliminate metal-on-metal contact, which is the leading cause of bottom bracket creaks. This bushing also helps enhance bearing longevity with an interface to the bearing gutter seal for maximum weatherproofing.

Installation

Installation of Wolf Tooth Bottom Brackets can be completed with standard tools – nothing proprietary required. Wolf Tooth also makes bottom bracket tools for easy installation. For BSA bottom brackets, the 44-16 Wolf Tooth Bottom Bracket Tool can install cups for the 24mm spindle, while the 46-12 can be used for 29 and 30mm cups. T47 internal bottom brackets can use the 52-16 BB tool. The Wolf Tooth Pack Wrench pairs with Wolf Tooth Bottom Bracket Tools for simple installation.

Colors

Four colors are currently available for Wolf Tooth bottom brackets: black, raw silver, orange, and ultraviolet purple. These colors match with other components and accessories in the Wolf Tooth Color Shop, where customers can shop based on color and pair bottom bracket color with headset, seatpost clamp, bottle cage bolts, pedals, and more.

Made in the USA

All Wolf Tooth Bottom brackets are machined in-house at its HQ in Minnesota using custom AlSl 52100 chrome bearing steel hardened to Rc 61-66. Bearings feature a lifetime warranty.

Specs:

  • Colors: black, raw silver, orange, ultraviolet purple
  • Compatible with most 24, 29, and 30mm spindle diameter cranksets
  • Adjustable-width shells for BSA and T47 internal models
  • Best-in-class sealing protects bearings from water and trail debris
  • Custom polymer spindle bushings prevent creaking and prolong the life of the crankset
  • Standard spline tools are used for installation, service, and removal
  • Custom AlSl 52100 chrome bearing steel hardened to Rc 61-66 reduces friction for smooth pedaling with ZNA corrosion-resistant coating
  • Lifetime warranty on bearings
  • Replacement parts and service guides available via Wolf Tooth Right to Repair
  • Price is $129.95 for BSA and $139.95 for T47 Internal
  • Machined at Wolf Tooth HQ in Minnesota, USA
